Dbaṅ Phur thugs kyi thig le bkaʾ rgya maʾi phrin las ʾbriṅ po khrigs bsdebs Bdud-ʾjoms-rdo-rjeʾi thog phreṅ. -- Bar chad kun sel byed dbaṅ Phur thugs kyi thig le bkaʾ rgya maʾi Phur sruṅ gsol mchod rgyas pa Phrin las kun ʾgrub bźugs so. -- Bar chad sel byed dbaṅ Phur thugs kyi thig le bkaʾ rgya maʾi Phur sruṅ gsol mchod Phrin las lhun grub. -- Dbaṅ Phur thugs kyi thig leʾi yid kyi ʾgyod bśags brjod med don gyi kloṅ bśags Rig pa raṅ grol. --Dbaṅ Phur thugs kyi thig leʾi Phrin las Phur paʾi dkyil khor gyi lha tshogs bskul ba dug mdaʾ phog ʾgyel. -- Bskul ʾgrel. -- Bar chad kun sel byed dbaṅ Phur thugs kyi thig le bkaʾ rgya maʾi gdab kha Gdug can kun sgrol / Dpal-gyi-rdo-rje. -- Bar chad sel byed dbaṅ gi Phur pa thugs kyi thig le bkaʾ rgya ma las zlog pa khor ʾdas yoṅs zlog. -- Phur zlog gi ʾgres byaṅ.
O-rgyan gu ru Padma-ʼbyuṅ-gnas la gsol ba ʼdebs pa gu ru ñid kyi źal luṅ leʼu bdun pa :
Bar chad lam sel, Rje ʼbaṅs ñer lṅa, Gter ston brgya rtsaʼi gsol ʼdebs, Smon lam bźugs so /

Gsol ʼdebs bar chad lam sel / O-rgyan-mchog-gyur-bde-chen-gliṅ-pa. -- Rje ʼbaṅs ñer lṅaʼi gsol ʼdebs byin rlabs dbaṅ gi chu rgyun / Dbaṅ-poʼi-sde. -- Sprul sku gter ston graṅs ṅes kyi gsol ʼdebs thugs rjeʼi ñin byed / Dbaṅ-poʼi-sde. -- [Gduṅ brgyud du ʼbyuṅ ba ma ʼoṅs luṅ bstan pa / Mkhyen-brtseʼi-dbaṅ-po. -- [Smon lam] / Mchog-ʼgyur-bde-chen-gliṅ-pa.
O-rgyan po Padma-ʼbyuṅ-gnas kyi rdo rjeʼ i gsuṅ ʼkhrul pa med paʼi gsol ʼdebs leʼu bdun ma :
lo rgyus daṅ bcas pa bźugs so /
"Par ʼdi Mtho dgon Bsam-gliṅ du bźugs."
Title on box: Leʼu bdun ma.

[Lo rgyus] -- Gsol ʼdebs bsam pa myur ʼgrub ma / ʼJigs-med-gliṅ-pa. -- Kha baʼi ljoṅs ʼdir dbaṅ dus su rtogs pa brñes paʼi sṅags ʼchaṅ grub thob rnams la gsol ʼdebs kyi tshigs su bcad pa Byin rlabs dbaṅ gi chu rgyun / Mchog-gyur-gliṅ-pa. -- Gsol ʼdebs bar chad lam sel / Mchog-gyur-gliṅ-pa. -- Gsol debs byin rlabs sprin spuṅ / Za-hor-gyi-bandhe. -- Bla ma mkhaʼ ʼgror gsol ʼdebs dṅos grub sprin phuṅ / Mkhaʼ-khyab-rdo-rje.
Rnal ʾbyor gyi dbaṅ phyug chen po Rje btsun Mi-la-ras-paʾi rnam par thar pa daṅ thams cad mkhyen paʾi lam ston źes bya ba bźugs so :

Half title: Źu-chen Tshul-khrims-rin-chen gyi Gsan yig.

v. 1. ʾJug yul śes paʾi ched dri bstan paʾi rnam par gźag pa. Jug sgo śes paʾi ched du thos bsam la rim gyis slob paʾi tshul. Thun moṅ ba phyi rig paʾi gnas. So sor thar paʾi sdom pa. Byaṅ chub sems dpaʾi sdom pa. Śes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gcod. De bźin gśegs paʾi rigs. Padmaʾi rigs. Rdo rje rigs. Nor can gyi rigs. Spyod paʾi rgyud. Rnal ʾbyor rgyud. Rgyud sde goṅ ʾog sna tshogs ʾdres pa. Gsaṅ sṅags sṅa ʾgyur. Rtsa gsum lha tshogs kyi sgrubs thabs ʾdod ʾjoʾi bum bzaṅ źes bya ba. Dpal gsaṅ ba ʾdus pa. Gśin-rjeʾi-gśed skor te ba rgyud. Rnal ʾbyor ma rgyud. Thabs śes gñis med dgyes pa rdo rjeʾi rgyud gsum. Dus kyi ʾkhor lo. Gser chos gsuṅ ṅag rin po che.

v. 2. Gser chos mkha spyod skor gsum. Gser chos dmar po skor gsum daṅ rmugs ʾdzin dmar po srog sgrub bcas pa. Gser chos rdo rje nag po chen po gur gyi mgon po. Stobs ʾphrog nag po gdoṅ bźi pa. Gser chos gdoṅ bźi paʾi bka sdod las mkhan dmar po gnod sbyin beg tse lcam dral. Dur khrod yab yum sogs dka sruṅ rnams. Śes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin paʾi skor yoṅs rdzogs sogs ston paʾi bkaʾ luṅ rin po che kha śas thos pa. ʾDir smos ma dgos pas de dag gi thos bsam don yod ched du ran ̇gźan don gñis bsgrub tshul.
Saṅs-rgyas-mñan-sprul dgu paʾi rnam thar mdor bsdus dad paʾi sa bon bźugs so.

Tshig bdun gsol ʾdebs byaṅ źus yin na ltuṅ ba bśags Bde-chen-źiṅ sgrub kyis gsol ʾdebs.--Gnam chos thugs kyi gter kha sñan brgyud zab mo Gu-ru Źi-baʾi skor las rtsa gsum spyi yi sṅon ʾgro.--Bde-chen-źiṅ gi sgrub thabs ʾdon cha.--Źiṅ sgrub zin bris kyi lhan thabs ñuṅ bsdus.--Bkaʾ sruṅ gsol mchod dkrigs chags su bris pa.--Tshogs mchod byin rlabs char ʾbebs.--Bde-chen-źiṅ sgrub gyi byaṅ chog thar lam dkar po.--Bde-chen-źiṅ gi ro sreg cho ga ṅan soṅ gnam ʾdren sdug bsṅal mtsho skem gtan bde rab ʾbar.--Bde-chen-źiṅ sgrub kyi dbaṅ ʾgrig chags su bkod pa.--Dbaṅ bsdus.--Bkra śis rtags brgyad kyi dbaṅ.--Bde-chen-źiṅ sgrub kyi zin bris.--Bde-chen-źiṅ du ʾpho baʾi gdams pa rgyas par bsgrigs pa.--Mkhas-grub Rā-ga-a-syas mdzad paʾi rnam dag Bde-chen-źiṅ gi smon lam.

"In 1881 the N.T. was completed and revised by A.W. Heyde and F.A. Redslob, assisted by a baptized lama named Nathaniel. The Gospels were printed in 1883 in the oblong form used for all previous Bible-editions in Tibetan except No. 9277; the remaining books of the N.T. were printed in 1885 in the form common to European books. All these were printed 'by Unger Brothers (Th. Grimm) in Berlin', with a fount of type which had been specially cast at Berlin for printing a Tibetan dictionary, on which H.A. Jaeschke was then engaged for the Indian Government."--Historical catalogue of the printed editions of Holy Scripture in the library of the British and Foreign Bible Society, volume 2, part 3, page 1603.

Mgur daṅ tshogs gluʼi skor phyogs gcig tu bsdebs pa Skal bzaṅ yid kyi dgaʼ ston.--ʼDun ma bzaṅ poʼi glu bro gñug maʼi rol rtsed yod.--Bslab byaʼi sñiṅ gtam gyi rim pa phyogs gcig tu bsdebs pa Skal ldan sñiṅ gi bdud rtsi.--Gsol mchod skoṅ phrin sna tshogs paʼi skor dgos ʼbyuṅ Nor buʼi gru char.--Lhag paʼi lhaʼi rgyun khyer gyi rim pa phyogs gcig tu bsdebs pa Dṅos grub ʼdod ʼjoʼi gter bum.

Gaṅs ljoṅs rgyal bstan yoṅs rdzogs kyi phyi mo sṅa ʾgyur Rdo rje theg paʾi bstan pa rin po che ji ltar byuṅ baʾi tshul dag ciṅ gsal bar brjod pa Lha dbaṅ gýul las rgyal baʾi rṅa bo cheʾi sgra dbyaṅs źes bya ba bźugs so /
Lha dbaṅ gýul las rgyal baʾi rṅa bo cheʾi sgra dbyaṅs.

Byaṅ chub sems gab pa dgu skor gyi dbu yi sa gcod kyi leʾu -- Byaṅ chub sems gab pa dgu skor -- Sdoṅ po dgu ʾdus lta baʾi rgyud chen -- Gsas mkhar gʹyuṅ druṅ ye khyebs lta baʾi rgyud -- Sems luṅ gab pa dgu skor gyi ʾgrel pa rgya cher bśad pa / Śes-rab-bzaṅ-po -- Gśen-rab rnam par rgyal baʾi yi (!) bźin nor buʾi smon lam sogs; Smon lam rnam gsum; other assorted smon lams.

Bde gśegs ʾdus pa sgrub pa Bkaʾ brgyad bskyed rdzogs ʾbriṅs paʾi sṅon ʾgro las rim bdun pa.--Bde gśegs ʾdus pa sgrub ba Bkaʾ brgyad bskyed rdzogs ʾbriṅ paʾi dṅos gźi las byaṅ don brgyad ma.--Bkaʾ brgyad khro bo rol gnam lcags thog chen gyi bzlog paʾi bcaʾ bźin nag ʾgros su bkod pa.--Bde gśegs sgrub pa Bkaʾ brgyad kyi sgo dbye gser skyems daṅ gzor bcas pa.--Bkaʾ brgyad Bde gśegs ʾdus paʾi gtor bzlog khro bo rol paʾi cha lag gdams phran daṅ bcas paʾi lag len gnam lcags rdo rje thog chen źes bya bar lus ʾbriṅ po daṅ man sṅags.
Bkaʾ brgyad Bde gśegs ʾdus pa.

Źi khro dgȯns pa raṅ grol :

edited and supplemented by Rig-ʼdzin Ñi-ma-grags-pa of Khams.
"Printed from blocks preserved in the Khaṅ-gsar Fortress (Gemur Temple) in Gar-źwa."

Chos ñid bar doʼi gsol ʼdebs thos grol chen mo.--Ñi-zla-ʼod-zer. Khro boʼi bar do ʼchar tshul bstan pa.--Saṅs rgyas daṅ byaṅ chub sems dpaʼ rnams la ra mdaʼ sgran paʼi smon lam.--Bar doʼi rtsa tshig.--Bar do ʼphraṅ sgrol kyi smon lam.--Srid pa bar doʼi ṅo sprod.--Btags grol phuṅ po raṅ grol.--ʼChi ltas mtshan ma raṅ grol.--Padma-ʼbyuṅ-gnas. Rig pa ṅo sprod gcer mthoṅ raṅ grol.--Padma-ʼbyuṅ-gnas. Srid pa bar doʼi dge sdig raʼn gzugs bstan paʼi gdams pa srid pa bar do raṅ grol.--Srid pa bar doʼi dge sdig raṅ gzugs bstan paʼi lhan thabs.--Brgyud paʼi gsol ʼdebs.--Padma. ʼChi bslu ʼjigs pa raṅ grol. Źi khro kloṅ bśags brjod pa raṅ grol.--Btags grol yid bźin nor mchog.--Chos spyod bag chags raṅ grol.
Źi khro dgoṅs pa raṅ grol /
Xylograph from blocks kept at Jo-khaṅ Ri-khrod in Gangtok.

Padma-ʼbyuṅ-gnas. Sku gsum bla maʼi rnal ʼbyor gyi gsol ʼdebs dug gsum ma spaṅ raṅ grol.--Chos ñid bar doʼi gsal ʼdebs thos grol chen mo.--Srid pa bar doʼi ṅo sprod gsal ʼdebs thos grol chen mo.--Chos spyod bag chags raṅ grol źes bya ba Bar do thos grol gyi cha lag.--Saṅs rgyas daṅ byaṅ chub sems dpaʼ rnams ra mdar sbran paʼi smon lam ʼjigs pa raṅ grol, la sogs.--Btags grol phuṅ po raṅ grol gyi don bsdus raṅ grol sñiṅ po.--Brgya phyag sdig sgrib raṅ grol źes bya ba Bar do thos grol gyi cha lags.--Padma-ʼbyuṅ-gnas. Źi khroʼi kloṅ bśags brjod pa raṅ grol.--ʼChi ltas mtshan ma raṅ grol.--Rdzogs pa chen poʼi lo rgyas mdo byaṅ po ti smug chuṅ las, ʼChi bslu zab mo.

Dgoṅs gter skyes mchog dgra lhaʾi rgyal po Ge-sar rdo rje tshe rgyal gyi srog gtad kyi chog sgrig rdo rjeʾi rwa gdeṅs phrin las rol mtsho.--Sku rje Ge-sar bsaṅs mchod dgos ʾdod char ʾbebs.--Ge-sar skyes bu don ʾgrub kyi sgrub thabs grub gñis dpyid ster las bźi lhun ʾgrub.--Skyes mchog Ge-sar rgyal poʾi zab sgrub dgra las rnam rgyal.--Skyes bu Ge-sar gyi dgoṅs tig zla źal ma.--Ge-sar skyes bu chen po la brten paʾi tshe sgrub ñi zla ʾod ʾbar.--Skyes mchog chen poʾi thugs thig las: sṅon ʾgro rnam mkhyen lam bzaṅ.--Skyes mchog chen poʾi thugs thig las: ʾDzam-gliṅ rgyan mchog seṅ chen rjeʾi tshe sgrub ʾchi med chu rgyun.--Skyes mchog chen poʾi thugs thig gi dbaṅ chog bdud rtsiʾi bum bzaṅ.

Skyes mchog chen poʾi thugs thig gi bkaʾ sruṅ legs ldan tshogs kyi bdag poʾi sgrub phrin ʾdod dguʾi char ʾbebs.--Skyes mchog chen poʾi thugs thig gi gter sruṅ lha klu gñan gsum gyi gsol ka phrin las char rgyun bskul baʾi brug sgra.--Rigs gsum Padmaʾi sgyu ʾphrul skyes mchog seṅ chen nor bu dgra ʾdul gyi sgrub thabs bskaṅ gsol daṅ bcas pa rgyas par bkod pa ʾdod ʾbyuṅ nor buʾi rgyal po.--Skyes mchog seṅ chen rgyal po yi sgrub thabs sñiṅ gi nor bu.--Seṅ chen nor bu dgra ʾdul gyi gsol mchod don kun lhun grub lha yi rṅa chen.--Dbaṅ chen rdo rjeʾi rkyaṅ rgod phel po la brten paʾi rta lhaʾi gʹyaṅ sgrub dge mtshan ʾdod dguʾi sgo ʾbyed.

Saʾi-sñiṅ-poʾi rnam thar phyogs gcig gi cha śas ... rgyal po smon lam rgya mtsho graṅs med pa Rjes su sgrog paʾi sprin gyi char.--Sgrib-pa-thams-cad-rnam-par-sel-baʾi rnam thar phyogs gcig gi cha śas ... rgyal po tiṅ ṅe ʾdzin rgya mtsho graṅs med pa Rjes su sgrog paʾi sprin gyi char.--Rgyal-sras Nam-mkhaʾi-sñiṅ-poʾi rnam thar phyogs gcig gi cha śas ... rgyal po sems can sñiṅ-poʾi rnam thar phyogs gcig gi cha śas ... rgyal po sems can gyi bsam pa daṅ spyod pa la ʾjug pa rgya mtsho graṅs med Rjes su sgrog paʾi sprin char.--ʾPhags-pa Kun-tu-bzaṅ-poʾi rnam thar phyogs gcig gi cha śas ... rgyal po rnam thar rgya mtsho graṅs med pa Rjes su sgrog paʾi sprin gyi char.

Rje-btsun Spyan-ras-gzigs-dbaṅ-phyug gi rnam thar phyogs gcig gi cha śas la cuṅ zad bsṅags pa Nor bu rin po cheʾi rgyal po bsod nams daṅ ye śes kyi tshogs rgya mtsho graṅs med ba rjes su sgrag paʾi sprin gyi char.--Dpal Rdo-rje-ʾdzin-paʾi rnam thar phyogs gcig gi cha śas ... rgyal po gzuṅs rgya mtsho graṅs med pa Rjes su sgrog paʾi sprin gyi char.--Rgyal-tshab Byams-pa Mgon-poʾi rnam thar phyogs gcig gi cha śas ... rgyal po rol tu phyin pa rgya mtsho graṅs med pa Rjes sgrogs paʾi sprin gyi char.-- Byaṅ-chub-sems-dpaʾ

The Nyingmapa sect. Chant asking the blessing of the Guru Drakmar. -- The Nyingmapa sect. Instruments of the monastery orchestra. Two shawms (rGyaling) ; Two long trumpets (dung) ; Two shell-trumpets made from conches (dung-dkar) ; Two short horns (rKang-ling) ; Hand-bell (drilbu) and hand-drum (damaru) ; Cymbals (rolmo) ; Cymbals (silnyen) ; Pole-drum (rGna) ; Ritual (for attaining the qualities of) spiritual adepts. -- The Kagyupa Sect. Religious preaching (of the Lord Buddha) date the fifteenth (day of the fourth Tibetan month) ; Morning music for shawms and trumpets ; Evening music for shawms and trumpets ; Prayer.

Monks of the Entchi Monastery, Gangtok, Sikkim (Nyingmapa Sect) (nos. 1-10) ; monks (Tibetan) of the Monastery, Rumtek, Sikkim (Kagyupa Sect) (nos. 12a-b and 13a-b) ; monks (Tibetan) of the Monastery, Rumtek, Sikkim, with members of the (Tibetan) lay community (Kagyupa Sect) (nos. 11a-b) ; monks of the Sgang-Ngon Monastery, Pʾhiuyang, Ladak (Kagyupa Sect) (no. 14).
Recorded May 26-June 14, 1961 in Tibet by Alain Daniélou.
Buddhist chants, ritual and ceremonial music, and theater music.

"Byang chub sems dpai̓ spyod pa la j̕ug pai̓ sa bcad don gsal me long, analytic table of contents of Shantideva's Bodhicaryavatara / by Patrul Rinpoche Orgyen Jigme Chökyi Wangpo (dpal sprul o rgyan j̓igs med chos kyi dbang po, 1808-1887)" "Byang chub sems dpai̓ spyod pa la j̕ug pai̓ mchan ģrel, word to word commentary of the Bodhicaryavatura, by Shenphen Jampai Gocha (gzan phan byams pai̓ go cha), better known [as] Khenpo Shenphen Chōkyi Nangwa (mkhan po gzhan phan chos kyi snang ba, 1871-1927), or Khenpo Shenga (gzhan dga)̓"--English prefatory material.

"Rgya gar lho phyogs Maʼi sor Sṅa ʼgyur mtho slob mdo sṅags rig pa'i 'byuṅ gnas gliṅ gi gtso wo lo rim dgu'i slob tsan rgya bod mkhas dbaṅ gis mdzad pa'i 'grel chen rnams kyi dbu phyogs bźugs so"--Prelim. p. 1.

"This volume has nine texts, all belonging to Sutra class. Text[s] "ka" through "ja" are about the elementary art of debate called bsdus grwa. Text[s] "nya" through "ta" are on logic (tshad ma), and text "tha" on mind..."--Pref.
Sa lam rnam b̓yed P̓hrul sgron rtsa ģrel theg chen gzhi lam b̓ras bu rtsa ģrel dbu ma rtsa 'grel skor gyi gsung Pod bzhugs.
Sa lam rnam ʾbyed ʾphrul sgron rtsa ʾgrel theg chen gźi lam ʾbras bu rtsa ʾgrel dbu ma rtsa ʾgrel skor gyi gsuṅs pod bźungs

"This volume has eleven texts. Text "ka" and "kha" are about the path practice (lam rim). Texts "ga", "nga" and "ca" are about the paths and grounds (sa lam) of prajnaparamita practice. [The] next two texts are on madhyamika philosophy--(cha) the root text and (ja) its commentary. Text "nya" is a prayer called tshig bkra, recited by a candidate during his geshi ceremony. Text "ta" is about the difference between Bon and Buddhism. [The] next three texts are on Tibetan grammar--"tha" is a grammar text, "da" a Bon lexicon, and "na" is on verb forms and tense. Text "pa" is a Zhang-zhung-Tibetan dictionary. Text "pha" is about the difference between Bon rnying ma and Bon gsar ma; the author argues that there is no doctrinal difference. Texts "ba" and "ma" are on poetry. And text "tsa" is the personal instructions on spiritual practices by dBra-ston zla-grags"--Pref.
Theg pa chen po shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pai̓ rtsa ģrel skor gyi gsungs pod bzhugs so.
Theg pa chen po śes rab kyi pha rol du phyin paʾi rtsa ʾgrel skor gyi gsuṅs pod bźugs so
The texts in this volume are on Pragnaparmita teachings, which are divided into eight parts called gnas brgyad. The eight texts ("ka" through "nya") in this volume deal with the eight parts in turn.
Lung mtshan nyid srid pai̓ mdzod phug rtsa ģrel dang bstan pai̓ srog shing d̓ul ba gzhung ģrel gsungs pod bzhugs so.
Luṅ mtshan ñid srid paʾi mdzod dPhug rtsa ʾgrel dang bstan Paʾi srog shiṅ ʾdul ba gźuṅ ʾgrel gyi gsuṅ pod gźugs so

This volume has texts dealing with two different subjects--cosmology (mdzod) and monastic rules (d̓ul ba). Texts 1 and 2 are about cosmology. Text 1 has a root-text and its commentary. Text 2 is a summary written in verse for memorization. Texts 3 through 9 are about the rules for monks and nuns and the rituals performed during ordination.
Theg pai̓ rim pa mngon du bshad pi̓ [sic] mdo rgyud rtsa ģrel dang mu stegs tshar gcod gtan tshigs thigs mdo bcas bźugs.
Theg paʾi rim pa mṅon du bśad paʾi mdo rgyud rtsa ʾgrel daṅ mu stigs tshar gcod gtan tshigs thig mdo bcas bźugs

This volume has texts dealing with all the three classes, Sutra, Tantra and Dzogchen. Text "ka" is a word-by-word commentary to the bilingual (Zhang-zhung and Tibetan) root-text on cosmology, Srid pai̓ mdzod phug. Text "kha" is a commentary to rNam rgyal khang bzang, a eulogy of mNyam-med shes-rab rgyal-mtshan (1356-1415). Text "ga" is about the nine yanas, consisting of a root text taught by Samboghakaya Buddha gShen-lha o̓d-dkar and its commentary taught by Nirmanakaya Buddha gShen-rab. Text "nga" is about the refutation of false doctrines called the doctrine of heretics. Text "ca" is a commentary to text "nga". Text "cha" is about the concept of ji bzhin nyid of Dzogchen philosophy. Text "ja" is a summary of the entire Prajnaparamita doctrine. Text "nya" is about the three characteristics of the Mind only school (Vijnanavada). Lastly, text "ta" is a short prayer for the better spread of Bon religion.
gSang sngags gsang don rnam ʾbyed dang rtsa rgyud bsen thub ʾgrel yid bzhin rnam par bkod paʾi rgyan bzhugs so.
Gsaṅ sṅags gsaṅ don rnam ʾbyed daṅ rtsa rgyud bsen thub ʾgrel yid bźin rnam par bkod paʾi rgyan bźugs so

The five texts in this volume are about Tantra. Text "ka" is the root text of tantric practice, spyi spungs, the tantra of wrathful deities. Text "kha" is the commentary of text "ka". Text "ga" is about the rituals and the practice of the Deity dBal-gsas, the principle deity of spyi-spungs practice. Text "nga" is about mandala creation. Text "ca" is a summary of all tantric practices written in verses for memorization.

v. 1. 'Dul ba'i gleṅ 'bum -- v. 2. 'Dul ba'i gleṅ 'bum: dum bu phyi ma -- v. 3. 'Dul ba mdo'i dgoṅs pa gsal bar byed pa -- v. 4. Mṅon pa mdzod kyi rnam bśad; So so thar pa'i mdo'i rnam bśad; Dbu ma la 'jug pa'i dgoṅs rab tu gsal ba'i me loṅ; Dbu ma rtsa ba śes rab kyi ṅag 'don bshad pa -- v. 5. Tshad ma'i spyi don rigs rgyan chen mo; Tshad ma rnam 'grel le'u bźi'i ṭika -- v. 6. Rnam thar and other short works.
Volume six includes the biography of Dge-ʼdun-grub, "Dge 'dun grub pa'i rnam thar nor bu'i phreṅ ba", written by Pan-chen Ye-śes-rtse-mo.
Volume six also includes "Dge 'dun grub pa'i rnam thar ṅo mtshar mdzad pa bcu gñis", by Las-chen Kun-dgaʼ-rgyal-mtshan.
Volume six also includes "Rnam-rgyal-grags-pa'i dri ba," questions on Byaṅ-bdag Rnam-rgya-grags-pa's "Abhisamayālaṅkāra-karika".

v. 1. Dpal gsaṅ ba 'dus pa mi bskyod rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga'i rnam par bśad pa dbaṅ don de ñid yaṅ gsal snaṅ ba rdo rje sems dpa'i źal luṅ (dbaṅ bskur ba'i cho ga) -- v. 2. Dga' ldan lha brgya ma'i 'khrid yig. Rdo rje 'jigs byed la brten pa'i bla ma'i rnal 'byor. Bla ma'i rnal 'byor gyi rim pa maṅ po phyogs gcig tu bkod pa dṅos grub 'dud rtsi'i char 'bebs. Rdo rje 'jigs byed la brten pa'i bla ma'i rnal 'byor rnams daṅ 'jigs byed dbaṅ gi brgyud 'debs. De'i bsgyed rdzogs dmar 'khrid brgyud 'debs. 'Jigs byed kyi dbaṅ bśad chen mo. De'i bskyed rim gyi 'khrid yig. De'i tshogs mchod. 'Jigs byed dpa' bo gcig pa'i dkyil cho ga. Bde mchog lu e pa daṅ mitra nas brgyud pa'i dbaṅ gi brgyud 'debs. Bril bu lha lṅa'i dbaṅ gi brgyud 'debs. De'i sgrub thabs. Lu i pa'i tshogs mchod -- v. 3. Sṅon 'gro'i chos bśad bya tshul. Bla ma daṅ saṅs rgyas byaṅ sems sogs la bstod ciṅ gsol ba 'debs 'brel ba'i brtan bźugs kyi rim pa phyogs gcig tu bsgrigs pa dge legs ñin mor byed pa'i snaṅ ba. Bcom ldan 'das dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i brgyud 'debs. De'i mchog dbaṅ goṅ ma rnams bskur tshul. De'i sku gsuṅ thugs yoṅs su rdzogs pa'i sgrub thabs. De'i thugs dkyil gyi sgrub thabs. De'i tshogs mchod --

v. 4. Bla ma byams pa rin po cher stsal ba'i źal gdams sos gdal gñid las sloṅ ba'i ñi ma la sogs pa ñams mgur gyi rim pa phyogs su bsdebs pa. Khri chen sprul pa'i sku'i rnam thar. Rdor sems lha bcu bdun ma'i dbaṅ gi brgyud 'debs. De'i sdrub thabs. De'i dkyil cho ga. Spyan ras gzigs rgyal ba rgya mtsho'i sgrub thabs. Rgyud sde nas gsuṅs pa'i lha tshogs du ma'i sgrub thabs kyi rim pa phyogs gcig tu bkod pa phen bde'i 'dod dgu ster ba yoṅs 'du'i 'khri. Spyan ras gzigs kha sar pā ṇi'i sgrub thabs daṅ rjes gnaṅ bya tshul las tshogs kyi rim ba. Gsaṅ ba dag drag po sum sgril gyi sgrub thabs. 'Jam dpal dbyaṅs a ra pa tsa na lha lṅa'i dbaṅ rgyud. De'i sgrub thabs. De'i dkyil cho ga. Mthu stobs thogs ba med pa'i dam can chos sruṅ du ma la mchod gtor 'bul ba daṅ bskad bśags bstod bskul sogs kyi rim ba phyogs gcig tu bkod pa phrin las rnam bźi'i 'dod 'jo. Dpal ldan lha mo'i mṅa' gsol -- v. 5. 'Khor chen sbyin srog. Bcu gcig źal gyi dbaṅ gi brgyud 'debs. De'i dbaṅ cho ga. Smyuṅ gnas kyi cho ga. Sgro drug ba'i gzuṅs kyi rnam bśad. Bstod sprin rgya mtsho'i 'grel ba. 'Da' ka ye śes kyi mdo 'grel. Smon lam śis brjod brtan bźugs bcas kyi rim pa phyogs gcig tu bkod pa nor bu dbaṅ gi rgyal po'i do śal. Rgya hor bod kyi mchog dman bar pa la stsal ba'i cha ba śog gi rim ba. Dwags po dge ba'i bśes gñen gyis mdzad pa'i 'jigs byed kyi dbaṅ cho ga la dag mchan gnaṅ ba. Bsaṅ sa mchod kyi rim pa phyogs gcig tu bkod pa --

v. 6. Sku gsuṅ thugs rten gsar bźens kyi źal byaṅ rgyab yig smon lam 'dod gsol dkar chag deb ther mgo brjod bcas phyogs bsdebs su bkod pa lags tshogs dpal gyi baṅ mdzod. Bde bar gśegs pa'i sku gzugs rten sogs kyi skor tshad kyi rim pa phyogs bsdebs byaṅ chen rgya mtshor bgrod pa'i śiṅ rta -- v. 7. Chos sde che chuṅ gi bca' yig sde brgyad la spriṅs yig lam yig sko 'ja' sogs kyi rim pa phyogs gcig tu bsgrigs pa 'jigs med gdoṅ lda'i sgo.

In the majestic setting of the Himalayas, the brilliant young monk Tashi returns to the world after three years of solitary meditation in a remote hermitage. At a harvest festival he meets the beautiful Pema, and chooses to quit monastic life for the challenges and wonders of the wider world.

Each collection contains multiple works on Tibetan literature which have been assembled specifically to be incorporated into institutional libraries. Each collection comprises roughly 1000 volumes from the TBRC holdings selected by E. Gene Smith, Executive Director of the Tibetan Buddhist Resource Center. Within each Core Text Collection, each work is provided in both Adobe Acrobat PDF and TIFF formats.

Bla ma Rdo-rje-drag-rtsal gyi go cha lha lṅaʼi ʼJam-dpal-nag-poʼi las tshogs grib sruṅ Bdud rtsiʼi bum pa. -- Dbaṅ Phur thugs kyi thig leʼi bla sgrub Rdo-rje-drag-rtsal gyi smad las bsad zlog dus ʼKhrug ʼjoms paʼi bskal paʼi bskal paʼi me chen. -- Dbaṅ Phur thugs kyi thig leʼi bla ma Rdo-rje-drag-rtsal gyi cha lag ʼgoṅ po ar gtad thar med ʼchi med bdag rṅam źal. -- Dbaṅ ... bla maʼi thugs sgrub Rdo-rje-drag-rtsal gyi cha lag smon log dam sri gnas spo ʼgoṅ po gru ʼded. -- Bla maʼi thugs sgrub Rdo-rje-drag-rtsal gyi cha lag nad rims bzlog paʼi rim pa mdos glud Nag bdag rims gcod. --

Dbaṅ ... bla maʼi thugs sgrub Rdo-rje-drag-rtsal gyi cha lag sa bcud gso ba bkrs śis bum pa. -- Dbaṅ ... bla maʼi thugs sgrub Rdo-rje-drag-rtsal gyi las mthaʼ nā ga klu ʼdul gyi rim pa ... -- Bla ma Rdo-rje-drag-rtsal gyi sruṅ ba Rdo rjeʼi go khrab. -- Dbaṅ ... bla ma Rdo-rje-drag-rtsal gyi rgyud rtsa ba Raṅ byuṅ rig paʼi rgyud kyi rgyal po. -- Dbaṅ ... bla maʼi thugs sgrub Rdo-rje-drag-rtsal gyi dbaṅ dpe Bsam don kun ʼgrub. -- Bla sgrub Rdo-rje-drag-rtsal gyi dbaṅ gi rim pa bklags chog tu bkod pa ʼJaʼ lus ʼchi med bum bzaṅ. -- Gter sruṅ gsol bsdus bsam don mgur ʼgrub.

In Tibetan or French with optional subtitles in English or French.

In the majestic setting of the Himalayas, the brilliant young monk Tashi returns to the world after three years of solitary meditation in a remote hermitage. At a harvest festival he meets the beautiful Pema, and chooses to quit monastic life for the challenges and wonders of the wider world.
Originally released as a motion picture in 2001.

Documents the ancient traditions and day-to-day rituals of a Tibetan nomadic community on a three-month pilgrimage. Observing age-old taboos and steadfast homage to the deities of nature, four men meticulously plan their yak caravan to fetch precious salt from the holy lakes of the Changtang region of northern Tibet.

"Rgyal ba ʼBri-guṅ-paʼi mtshan gyis byin gyis brlabs pa Dkon-mchog-bstan-ʼdzin Kun-bzaṅ-phrin-las-lhun-grub pas Me Sprul [= 1987] zla 9 tshes 22 la rdzogs par sbyar ste yig mkhan Smon-lam-mthar-phyin-pas bris pa" --p. 507.

Bla ma mchod paʼi cho ga daṅ sgron maʼi maṇḍala bźi paʼi cho ga byaṅ chub ltuṅ bśags kyi cho ga sogs bźugs so.
Collection of eight liturgical texts from the ʼBri-guṅ-bkaʼ-brgyud tradition.

1. Bla ma mchod paʼi cho ga byin rlabs char ʼbebs / [Bstan-ʼdzin-chos-kyi-blo-gros kyis gdan sa chen po dpal ʼBri-guṅ du sbyar baʼo] -- 2. Bla ma mchod paʼi smon lam / [Gam-bcar Gzim-dpon Dge-sloṅ Dkon-mchog-śes-rab kyis bskul ṅor; ʼbri ba na, Dharma-sya-ma-tis bris so] -- 3. ʼPhags ma yid bźin ʼkhor loʼi sgo nas don gñis sgrub pa ʼchi med ʼdod ʼjoʼi brgyud rim dṅos grub kun ʼbyuṅ / [Lho-rje-druṅ Rig-ʼdzin O-rgyan-che-mchog Nus-ldan-rdo-rjes] -- 4. Sṅon ʼgro cha gsum gtor ma / [Rig-ʼdzin Chos-kyi-grags-pas mdzad paʼi bkaʼ brgyad chog bsgrigs ltar ro] -- 5. Bcom-ldan-ʼdas-ma Yid-bźin-ʼkhor-loʼi sgo nas maṇḍala bźi paʼi cho ga don gñis sgrub pa ʼchi med ʼdod ʼjo / [ʼBri-guṅ-pa Śākyaʼi-dge-sloṅ Chos-kyi-grags-pas...sbyar ba] -- 6. Byaṅ chub ltuṅ bśags kyi cho ga śin tu bsdus pa las sgrib rnam sbyoṅ / [ʼBri-guṅ-bkaʼ-brgyud gsuṅ rabs ñams gsoʼi sri źu ba Yo-red-tshaṇ Brtson-ʼgrus-seṅ-ges ʼphags yul rgyal sa Dillir phyi lo 2007 lor par du bźeṅs pa'o] -- 7. Byaṅ chub ltuṅ bśags kyi cho ga la sbyar bar bya baʼi gśin po rjes ʼdzin thar lam gsal sgron / [Źa-lu Blo-gsal-bstan-skyoṅ gsuṅ la ʼJam-mgo-koṅ-sprul gyis kha bskoṅ gnaṅ ba ñid gźir bźag la kha bsgyur bcas; bklag chog grub par bsdebs pa yi ge pa ni, Goṅ-pa Dkon-mchog-phrin-las kyis bgyis pa] -- 8. Mar meʼi smon lam ma rig mun sel / [Śākyaʼi-dge-sloṅ Dkon-mchog-bstan-ʼdzin Kun-bzaṅ-ʼphrin-las-lhun-grub kyis rab gnas sa stag lo ste 1998...bris pa].

Dge sloṅ Blo-bzaṅ-rin-chen gyi źu lan dogs sel źal gdams -- 6. Tiṅ ṅe ʼdzin gyi yan lag bdun paʼi dmigs rim gyi khrid yig bsdus pa bźugs so / [spar gźi ʼbri baʼi byed po daṅ spar byaṅ smon tshig sogs brjod pa po, Sprul-miṅ Dkon-mchog-ṅag-dbaṅ-phrin-las-chos-rgyal] -- 7. Written in red and black ink on both sides of leaves, chiefly 8 lines per leaf. Two painted miniatures on the first leaf measuring 13 x 13 centimeters each and one centered on an inner leaf measuring 6 x 7 centimeters.
Sutras with marginal commentary. Paintings depict Buddhist devotional imagery.
Leaves are loose with carved wooden board covers. Boards have worn gilt and red laquer.
MS Tibetan 2. Houghton Library, Harvard University.

Written in gold in on both sides of leaves, chiefly 8 lines per leaf. Leaves are dyed indigo with waxed centers where writing is. Two leaves (ff. 1 and 5) consist of several leaves stitched together and the gold writing is covered with silk cloth. Cloth cover of first folio is brocade. Includes 3 white leaves, one blank, the others written in black and red ink.

Leaves are loose with carved wooden board covers. Boards are carved, one with figures of gods and animals with worn red and yellow paint, and one with floral scroll design with red, green, and yellow paint.

The year is 1998 and the World Cup has just been kicked into high gear. But for four monks living deep in the Himalayas, watching their favorite sport isn't only difficult -- it's forbidden. As soccer fever heats up, the young monks break the rules, sneak out of their monastery and risk their futures in a madcap adventure that's all for the love of the game.

According to the introduction, this Tibetan-Tibetan dictionary project started in 2004 and seeks to be comprehensive by addressing gaps in existing dictionaries by including contemporary terms (some English words are used for illustration) as well as terms from Bon tradition, local dialects, etc. that may not be found in existing dictionaries; includes chronology from 3717 BC to 2011 CE, the periodic and other tables of scientific terms in Tibetan, and a trilingual (Chinese-Tibetan-English) table with selected neologisms.
